title: Tibu
author: Tibu
created_time: December 13, 2023, 02:55:30 PMLast edit: December 19, 2023, 07:27:37 AM by Tibu
content: Hello,I'm pleased to announce that we have released the complete collection.This Bitcointalk forum 14th anniversary edition is a limited edition of 4 Satoshi Nakamoto famous quotes you can find in this forum.Only 5 cards of each quote has been printed and loaded with the Satochip (hardware wallet) applet. A true collectible!Serie #1 - SOLD OUTQuoteIf you don't believe it or don't get it, I don't have the time to try to convince you, sorry.Shop nowSerie #2 SOLD OUTQuoteThe root problem with conventional currency is all the trust that's required to make it work.Shop nowSerie #3 SOLD OUTQuoteLost coins only make everyone else’s coins worth slightly more. Think of it as a donation to everyone.Shop nowSerie #4 ONLY 2 LEFTQuoteWhy delete a wallet [...]  You should never delete a wallet.Shop now--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------There are a few cards left for series #2, #3 and #4. But hurry up, it won't last long!Shop now at: https://satochip.io/shop/

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: This cards could be a cool gift for upcoming holidays.It looks like Satochip Limited Edition cards with quote #3 are sold out, same like cards with quote #1.I think there are few more cards available with quote #2 and quote #4, but this won't be printed again when it gets sold.Code:The root problem with conventional currency is all the trust that's required to make it work.Code:Why delete a wallet [...]  You should never delete a wallet.

comments.author: Cyrus
comments.body: Wonderful idea, these look really good. Also, good job with the layout!A pitty I wasn't able to acquire a complete set. Guess will to settle for 2/4.

comments.author: DabsPoorVersion
comments.body: I was just wondering, what is the difference between this edition and the first edition released?

comments.author: Tibu
comments.body: Quote from: DabsPoorVersion on December 15, 2023, 04:07:57 AMI was just wondering, what is the difference between this edition and the first edition released?Hello, What do you mean by "the first edition released" ? Thank you.

comments.author: DabsPoorVersion
comments.body: Quote from: Tibu on December 15, 2023, 11:21:47 AMQuote from: DabsPoorVersion on December 15, 2023, 04:07:57 AMI was just wondering, what is the difference between this edition and the first edition released?Hello, What do you mean by "the first edition released" ? Thank you.This one.As far as I remember, the first batch was already out of stock, that's why I asked what's the difference (e.g. material, design)Quote from: dkbit98 on November 29, 2023, 11:05:08 PMOh boy that was fast!We are now officially OUT OF STOCK for this Satochip card design, looks like you snatched one of those gems in the last moment

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: DabsPoorVersion on December 15, 2023, 04:07:57 AMI was just wondering, what is the difference between this edition and the first edition released?Design and inside of the cards should be exactly the same, and only difference in all four card series is the different quotes from Satoshi (written above in OP).To be perfectly honest, my idea was to have small color change on the backside with logo, to easily differentiate between different card quotes, but guys from Satochip didn't follow my suggestion about this.You can see here how the cards look in real life, with images posted by previous customers: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5474907.msg63231800#msg63231800Quote from: Cyrus on December 15, 2023, 03:46:07 AMWonderful idea, these look really good. Also, good job with the layout!A pitty I wasn't able to acquire a complete set. Guess will to settle for 2/4.Stay tuned and follow this topic and Collectibles board, you might be surprised again

comments.author: Tibu
comments.body: QuoteSerie #4 ONLY 2 LEFTQuoteWhy delete a wallet [...]  You should never delete a wallet.Shop nowLast chance to grab this limited edition. I like this quote... You know why? Because here at Satochip, we have made a product called Seedkeeper that allows you to safely store your seedphrase in a tamper proof secure element. The very first hardware for seed. And one thing that people disslike in the product is that you CANT remove an entry. Indeed, we assume that a seedphrase should never be deleted, for a variety of reasons:- the presence of a fork that would offer you new tokens at this address- Bitcoin dust that could be worth a fortune in a few years' time- an oversight on your part and you depositing funds there.You should never delete a wallet. You should never delete a seedphrase. Follow Satoshi's quote and thanks him later

comments.author: mx12.levins
comments.body: Quote from: Tibu on December 19, 2023, 07:32:17 AMQuoteSerie #4 ONLY 2 LEFTQuoteWhy delete a wallet [...]  You should never delete a wallet.Shop nowLast chance to grab this limited edition. I like this quote... You know why? Because here at Satochip, we have made a product called Seedkeeper that allows you to safely store your seedphrase in a tamper proof secure element. The very first hardware for seed. And one thing that people disslike in the product is that you CANT remove an entry. Indeed, we assume that a seedphrase should never be deleted, for a variety of reasons:- the presence of a fork that would offer you new tokens at this address- Bitcoin dust that could be worth a fortune in a few years' time- an oversight on your part and you depositing funds there.You should never delete a wallet. You should never delete a seedphrase. Follow Satoshi's quote and thanks him later I wanted to pick up one of these cards, but the fees were around $20 in bitcoin. I could wait for the fees to drop or, if possible, pay via Lightning to you?

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.created_time: December 19, 2023, 11:07:15 PMLast edit: December 20, 2023, 11:57:51 AM by dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: mx12.levins on December 19, 2023, 12:09:44 PMI wanted to pick up one of these cards, but the fees were around $20 in bitcoin. I could wait for the fees to drop or, if possible, pay via Lightning to you?Fees are crazy this days.I think Satochip is using Coinbase Commerce for processing all cryptocurrency payments, and this is what I found on their website:QuoteWe currently support ApeCoin, Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, DAI, Dogecoin, Ethereum, Litecoin, SHIBA INU, Tether and USD Coin.We also support MATIC, USD Coin, and Wrapped Ether (WETH) on Polygon.https://www.coinbase.com/commerce/faqIf you don't have any LTC and other altcoins, maybe you can contact Tibu or someone else from Satochip support and ask them to pay directly with Lightning.I think guys from Satochip should use btcpayserver.org in future for BTC and LN payments.

comments.author: DabsPoorVersion
comments.body: A few weeks ago, I was one of the people who ordered the previous series of cards. However, I received an email stating that for an unknown reason, I was able to "backorder" the card which was already sold out. Later, I received an offer to receive the first one of the new batch. Finally, the card has been delivered, and I am grateful for it. I liked it so much and wanted to thank you for this wonderful card.

comments.author: Tibu
comments.body: Quote from: DabsPoorVersion on December 20, 2023, 10:06:46 AMA few weeks ago, I was one of the people who ordered the previous series of cards. However, I received an email stating that for an unknown reason, I was able to "backorder" the card which was already sold out. Later, I received an offer to receive the first one of the new batch. Finally, the card has been delivered, and I am grateful for it. I liked it so much and wanted to thank you for this wonderful card.  After carefully analyzing the situation, we realized where the problem lay. In fact, you ordered cards and made a payment in Bitcoin, which took several hours to be confirmed due to network congestion. Meanwhile, the cards were "reserved" but not paid for. The stock was not reduced accordingly and in the meantime, someone paid for the same cards by VISA. These were the last cards, hence the backorder. Again, sorry for the inconvenience.

comments.author: tldr-hodl
comments.body: So, the guy who paid with VISA didn't get his?

comments.author: Tibu
comments.body: Quote from: tldr-hodl on December 21, 2023, 10:13:15 AMSo, the guy who paid with VISA didn't get his?Everyone got a card
